intro: Hylaeaicum peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian hylaeaicum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
